intro: Frankenia chubutensis, commonly known as the Chubut firebush, is a flowering plant native to the Patagonian region of Argentina. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit with woody stems. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer seasons. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in coastal and inland areas with well-drained soils. Frankenia chubutensis is adapted to withstand drought and salt spray, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
